intro: Apocopis pulcherrimus, commonly known as the showy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and covered in fine hairs. Apocopis pulcherrimus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
